intro: Hieracium leucense, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with white rays, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium leucense is often found in temperate climates and is relatively hardy, though it can become invasive in some regions.
